project.teaser: It is widely acknowledged that Higher Education Institutions (HEIs) should go beyond their traditional education and research functions and also be key actors in promoting, creating and sustaining social innovation that responds to multifaceted challenges. Social innovation...
project.objective: It is widely acknowledged that Higher Education Institutions (HEIs) should go beyond their traditional education and research functions and also be key actors in promoting, creating and sustaining social innovation that responds to multifaceted challenges. Social innovation has gained relevance within the framework of academia at the international level, although is recognised the need to enable social innovation ecosystems across Europe through the adoption of systemic solutions, involving diverse actors, institutions, and places, involving all-kind of social innovation actors (social innovation actors/social entrepreneurs, SMEs, start-ups, accelerators and business incubators, investors, industry, foundations, philanthropy societies, HEIs and RTOs public-owned enterprises). Hence, Innovation Nexus starts from a clear commitment from the participating HEIs to balance the fourth helix by increasing the role of HEIs as drivers of social innovation, but in co-construction with other stakeholders from across the fourth helix. Specifically, a methodology consisting of two distinct (but complementary) phases has been defined. In the first phase, the focus will be on innovation actors and on building capacity among them, so that they become better equipped to work with social entrepreneurs; in the second phase, the focus will be on social innovation actors and on their access to the resources of innovation ecosystems.
project.title: Innovation Nexus

article.title: Strengthening the role of Higher Education Institutions

result.title: Report on the roll-out and findings of the Prototyping Fund
result.description: A Report on the roll-out and findings of the Prototyping Fund, which provides a safe space for students to experiment and test their ideas, will be produced.

result.title: Website
result.description: INNOVATION NEXUS will have a dedicated website featuring an openaccess database with project deliverables and outputs Furthermore the website will be designed with the latest user experience best practices including an interactive event calendar It will be available in all the partners languages Portuguese English Spanish and Swedish from M4

result.title: Report on the roll-out and findings of the Cultivation Events
result.description: As a pan-European festival, throughout the year, network members will host Cultivation Events that extend predetermined social innovation themes focussed around ideation, as an educational breeding ground for socially responsible ideation development. A Report on the roll-out and findings of the Cultivation Events will be produced.

result.title: Report on the roll-out and findings of the Design Jams
result.description: INNOVATION NEXUS will organize a design jam (one or two-day event) to invite university students from all disciplines as well as social innovators and professionals from multiple backgrounds (design, engineering, marketing, etc.) to collaborate during the Design Jam to develop solutions to tackle social and sustainability issues. A Report on the roll-out and findings of the Design Jams will be produced.

result.title: Report on the roll-out and findings of SHAPEing the World - Gathering
result.description: The SHAPEing the World Gathering is the ultimate educational, business and inspiration platform for the pan-European social innovation community. Combining the learnings gained across the year from the Cultivation events and research groups, the 3-day and night programme brings together the network and wider audiences to explore the spectrum of activity taking place across European social innovation ecosystems with a focus around socially responsible ideation, via an exhibition of findings, conferences, screenings, showcases, masterclasses, workshops and entertainment. A Report on the roll-out and findings of SHAPEing the World - Gathering will be produced.

result.title: Promotional Material and Branding
result.description: INNOVATION NEXUS will have its own brand and visual identity including digital and printed materials such as logos posters banners rollups and flyers

result.title: Report on models that can maximise audience amplification and engagement
result.description: The pan-European festival, tentatively titled SHAPEing the World, will unite members of the network across activities and events under a shared marketing campaign to maximise amplification and audience engagement. The models that can maximise audience amplification and engagement will be analysed and a detailed report will be produced.

result.title: Joint Sessions / Workshops Report [update]
result.description: Bron, together with other beneficiaries, will organise 2 workshops in Sweden with innovation ecosystem actors and public sector actors within their region (M3), and will also organise 2 sessions with other Digital Innovation Hubs (DIH) in Sweden (M4) to identify best practices, but also obstacles and challenges in working with social innovation from a general Swedish perspective as well as a specific DIH-perspective. Reports will be developed in M5 and M23.

result.title: Joint Sessions / Workshops Report
result.description: Bron together with other beneficiaries will organise 2 workshops in Sweden with innovation ecosystem actors and public sector actors within their region M3 and will also organise 2 sessions with other Digital Innovation Hubs DIH in Sweden M4 to identify best practices but also obstacles and challenges in working with social innovation from a general Swedish perspective as well as a specific DIHperspective Reports will be developed in M5 and M23

result.title: Toolkit for HEIs
result.description: A few guidelines have been published to inform the development and implementation of social innovationrelated actions However there is an obvious need for more extensive exchanges of information and reflection on experience in different contexts with different characteristics organizational logics and strategic plans The Toolkit for HEIs will allow more meaningful recommendations and more consolidated knowledge

result.title: Report on scalabe / replicable models for sustainable innovators
result.description: SNF, together with other beneficiaries, will search for the best cases of success regarding social innovation models/business models at scale in the European Ecosystem, and produce a detailed report that can be used by social innovators and different actors of the innovation ecosystem.

result.title: Final Report on the Evaluation of the Impact of the considered Initiatives
result.description: Metrics will be counted regarding the various initiatives implemented, especially those implemented in WP3, according to the framework detailed in T.5.2. As some initiatives (design jams, prototyping fund, impact builder) will have more than one edition, there will be room to learn, adjust, and improve during the time horizon of the project (incorporating feedback loops).

result.title: Report on the roll-out and findings of the Impact Builder
result.description: A Report on the roll-out and findings of the Impact Builder, which aims to improve the quality of newborn impact solutions and feed the pipeline of startups, produts and services already in place at this pan-Europen network, will be produced.

result.title: Report on the Final Dissemination Event
result.description: The consortium will create synergies with the main focus of creating a high-exposure event, involving all of the Target Groups focused on the proposal, to discuss, not only the state of the art in what concerns the integration of social innovation actors in innovation ecosystems, but also to identify most-likely paths for the future of such ecosystems, and mainly to promote the project’s results amongst all stakeholders. After that, a Report on the Final Dissemination Event will be produced.

result.title: Report on the State of the Art
result.description: The Report on the State of the Art will provide a systematic review of literature focused on an overview of the stateoftheart of knowledge on the roles of HEIs when it comes to enabling social innovation through its missions of teaching research and thirdfourth mission A bibliometric approach will be used to identify and analyse books journal articles and reports examining factors driving social innovation activities at HEIs organizational and institutional change to accommodate such activities as well as their impact Past results from projects that received funding from the EU will also be analysed

result.title: Report on the pan European characterisation of social innovation ecosystems
result.description: The Report on the pan European characterisation of social innovation ecosystems will show the available funding for social innovation projects and recommendations to improve the links between investors and social innovation projects and intermediaries

result.title: Interim Report on the Evaluation of the Impact of the considered Initiatives
result.description: Metrics will be counted regarding the various initiatives implemented, especially those implemented in WP3, according to the framework detailed in T.5.2. As some initiatives (design jams, prototyping fund, impact builder) will have more than one edition, there will be room to learn, adjust, and improve during the time horizon of the project (incorporating feedback loops).

result.title: Set-up of the necessary Social Media channels
result.description: INNOVATION NEXUS will create a strong social media presence where partners will upload content to create strong and alluring user interaction and traction Relevant news and helpful tools from other sources relating to social innovation will be integrated into the communications

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
